intro: Dyssodia papposa, commonly known as the hairy dyssodia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features a sprawling growth habit with hairy stems and leaves, and its flowers are typically yellow with white or pale pink ray florets. Dyssodia papposa is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It is also known for its ability to produce achenes with pappus structures, aiding in wind dispersal.
